title: Participatory Action Research (PAR)-Based Competency Development Course for University E-Book Service Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic library service operations experience and foundational knowledge of digital resource utilization
context.additional_context: Learners composed of current professionals enhance e-book service development capabilities through participatory action research. Applying informal/semi-formal learning methods suitable for non-degree adult learners facing difficulties in participating in formal educational courses.

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more technical and operational issues for improving e-book services and write an analytical report.
Learners can design an e-book service improvement project by applying the five phases of participatory action research (PAR): analysis, planning, implementation, evaluation, and reflection.
Learners can develop two or more e-book content selection and management systems incorporating peer feedback and apply them to real work environments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
